title: Methanation
description: Carbon monoxide (CO) methanation on the stepped fcc(211) Rhodium (Rh) surface facet. This model resembles a simplified version of the model presented by Mie Andersen in J. Chem. Phys. 147, 152705 (2017) and the reaction network includes different classes of surface reactions as well as different types of adsorption sites.

typeInfos.info: Carbon is a fundamental chemical element crucial for life on Earth and essential in various industries. It is found in all known life forms and plays a vital role in organic molecules, serving as the backbone of life's building blocks. Carbon's versatility allows it to form diverse compounds, making it indispensable in fields such as fuel production, plastics manufacturing, and electronics. Its abundance and ability to bond with other elements enable the creation of countless materials and substances, shaping the world we live in.

Oxygen is vital for supporting life on Earth, being a key component of the air we breathe and essential for the respiration of living organisms. Oxygen participates in numerous biochemical processes, providing energy and sustaining metabolic functions. It also plays a critical role in combustion reactions and the formation of various compounds, including water. Oxygen's abundance and reactivity make it indispensable in diverse industrial applications, from steel production to medical therapies.

Hydrogen is the simplest and most abundant chemical element in the universe, with the symbol H and atomic number 1. It plays a crucial role in numerous aspects of life and industry. As a component of water and organic compounds, hydrogen is essential for sustaining life and facilitating biochemical reactions. Its versatility extends to various industrial applications, including energy production through hydrogen fuel cells and the synthesis of ammonia for fertilizers. Hydrogen's potential as a clean and renewable energy source has garnered significant attention in efforts to reduce carbon emissions and transition to sustainable energy systems.

Rhodium is a rare and precious transition metal with the symbol Rh and atomic number 45. It is renowned for its remarkable properties, including exceptional resistance to corrosion and oxidation. Rhodium plays a critical role in catalytic converters, where it helps reduce harmful emissions from vehicles by converting pollutants into less harmful gases. Additionally, it finds applications in the production of high-performance catalysts for chemical reactions, as well as in jewelry and electroplating due to its lustrous appearance and durability. Despite its rarity, rhodium's unique characteristics make it indispensable in various industrial and technological sectors.
